author: Rafly Gilang
title: OneDrive shared folder showing as internet shortcut? You’re not the only one
text:
Microsoft still hasn’t fixed the bug that causes the OneDrive shared folder to show as an internet shortcut, despite being alerted by users almost half a year ago.
As the company notes on the support page , some OneDrive shared folder shortcuts in the “My Files” section appear as .url internet shortcuts instead of actual folders. When attempting to open them, you’ll be redirected to a webpage and may be prompted to sign in, rather than accessing the folder.
It’s an annoying major bug indeed. But, as annoying as it gets, what’s more annoying is how Microsoft still hasn’t said anything about its fix for half a year since the bug first started to appear.
A long discussion on the Microsoft Community forum from June 2024 details how this issue impacts both personal and business accounts, with many users expressing concerns about being unable to access their data directly, especially for tasks that require local access, such as running scripts.
That was weeks and months ago, and now, many are still returning to the thread to express frustration that Microsoft has still not provided a fix. Ouch.
“The issue is not that a major bug is present and known. The issue is that a major bug is present and hasn’t been fixed for nearly 6 months. This seems like a major lapse in quality and possibly care,” says a user on X who tipped us on this development.
The exact cause isn’t clear . Some users think it might be connected to Windows 11 version 22H2, but others haven’t had the issue with that version. There’s also a chance that a recent update (KB5037853) could be involved, but it’s not confirmed.

author: ET Bureau
title: renewable energy: Turning waste into wealth: NexGen Energia's innovative CBG plant promotes eco-friendly sustainable energy - The Economic Times
text: NexGen Energia, a leading renewable energy company, is all set to mark a significant milestone in India. In a groundbreaking move, the company will unveil one of India’s first compressed biogas (CBG) plants, leveraging the potential of Napier grass, in the town of Padruana, Kushinagar, Uttar Pradesh. The inauguration is scheduled for March.NexGen Energia’s pioneering venture aims to address the challenges of waste management and provide a renewable energy solution that promotes environmental well-being.Model For Future ProjectsThe CBG plant is expected to contribute significantly to the reduction of the nation’s carbon footprint, catering to the increasing energy demand while ensuring a minimal impact on the environment.The plant, equipped with state-of-the-art technology and modern infrastructure, has undergone rigorous testing and quality checks, ensuring the production of clean and sustainable energy.Speaking about the upcoming launch, Dr Piyush Dwivedi, chairman, NexGen Energia, said, “We are extremely proud and thrilled to introduce India’s first compressed biogas plant using Napier grass. This endeavour aligns perfectly with our commitment to combat the climate crisis and work towards a cleaner and greener India. We believe this breakthrough will pave the way for a brighter future, both environmentally director, and economically.”A Game-ChangerThe CBG plant is expected to create numerous employment opportunities in the region, stimulating local economic growth. Additionally, the project will contribute to the government’s vision of reducing reliance on fossil fuels and promoting sustainable alternatives.The company is leading the charge in harnessing the potential of Napier grass as a major feedstock for power generation. With 38 projects lined up, NexGen Energia is poised to revolutionise India’s energy landscape.Nishant Tiwari, director, NexGen Energia, said, “This is a game-changer for clean energy. The establishment of these 38 compressed biogas plants will not only reduce our reliance on fossil fuels but also contribute to waste management solutions. This project presents a tremendous opportunity for the biogas industry. The expansion of CBG plants will boost job creation, stimulate the rural economy and contribute to achieving our net-zero emission targets.”.

author: @cmjornal
title: Enfermeira britânica perde recurso da condenação por matar sete bebés em Inglaterra - Mundo - Correio da Manhã
text:
Padroeiro da Internet que morreu aos 15 anos vai ser o novo santo da Igreja Jovens que ganhem até 5800 euros por mês têm aval público para comprar casa Quem são as vítimas do desabamento de restaurante em Palma de Maiorca Grupo rapta e marca rapaz com ferro em brasa na Moita Letizia e Felipe VI já vivem separados. Saiba tudo aqui Descarrilamento do metro em Alvalade corta circulação na Linha Verde Mulher exige indemnização de 600 mil euros a ex-marido por "danos causados pela frustração do casamento" Aprovado alargamento do IVA da eletricidade a 6% para 3,4 milhões de famílias José Castelo Branco apanhado a sair de casa da amiga pela garagem Veja o vídeo da incrível festa "Somos Todos Gamers" com os convidados especiais Inês Aires Pereira fala da separação Relação do Porto confirma internamento a menor que aplicou "golpe mata-leão" a professora Reunião com médicos termina sem acordo. Governo não inclui aumento salarial nas negociações Oficial: Xavi despedido do Barcelona Chefe da espionagem russa diz que a Ucrânia esteve diretamente envolvida no ataque a sala de concertos em Moscovo “Melhor que um jogo do Benfica!”: Taylor Swift vai dar três horas de espetáculo na Luz Quer receber as últimas notícias no seu telemóvel ainda mais rápido? Siga aqui o ALERTA CM Enfermeira britânica perde recurso da condenação por matar sete bebés em Inglaterra Lucy Letby tentou matar outros seis bebés. Correio da Manhã 10:34 Lucy Letby FOTO: Cheshire Constabulary/Reuters A enfermeira britânica Lucy Letby perdeu o recurso da condenação por matar sete bebés e tentar matar outros seis, avançou esta sexta-feira a agência Reuters .
A homicida, de 34 anos, vitimou cinco meninos e duas meninas na unidade neonatal do hospital Condessa de Chester, no norte de Inglaterra.
O caso remonta a 2016. Entre as vítimas estão dois irmãos gémeos, um recém-nascido com menos de um quilo e uma menina que nasceu dez semanas antes do tempo.
Em junho, Lucy Letby vai enfrentar um novo julgamento por tentativa de homicício num tribunal de Manchester, Inglaterra.

author: Sakchi Khandelwal
title: bettermoo(d) Expands Moodrink Availability in Ontario's Major Grocery Chain
text:
In a bold move that underscores the growing shift towards sustainable food choices, bettermoo(d) Food Corporation, in partnership with United Natural Food (UNFI) Canada, has launched its plant-based milk alternative, Moodrink, across Canada's largest grocery retail chain. Starting today, consumers in Ontario can find Moodrink in at least 20 different locations, marking a significant milestone in the accessibility of dairy alternatives in the country. This expansion not only responds to the increasing demand for plant-based products but also aligns with bettermoo(d)'s vision for a healthier, more environmentally friendly future.
A Fresh Wave of Plant-Based Offerings
As the plant-based food industry burgeons, bettermoo(d)'s strategic partnership with UNFI Canada signifies a significant leap in making healthier, sustainable food choices more accessible to Canadians. Moodrink, touted for its unique taste and nutritional profile, represents a key innovation in the dairy alternative sector. This expansion brings to the forefront the shifting consumer preferences towards plant-based diets and the growing awareness around the environmental impact of traditional dairy farming.
Aligning with Consumer Demand
The decision to broaden Moodrink's availability comes at a time when demand for dairy alternatives is at an all-time high. Consumers are increasingly seeking out products that not only benefit their health but also have a lesser environmental footprint. bettermoo(d) Food Corporation's move to make Moodrink available in Ontario's leading grocery chain is a testament to the brand's commitment to meeting this demand. It also showcases UNFI Canada's role as a pivotal player in distributing healthier, sustainable food options across the nation.
A Step Towards a Greener Future
Through this expansion, bettermoo(d) and UNFI Canada are setting new standards for the food industry. By making Moodrink more accessible, they are not just offering consumers a healthier dairy alternative but are also contributing to a larger movement towards environmental sustainability. This initiative is a clear indication of bettermoo(d)'s dedication to not just leading in the plant-based food industry but also to promoting eco-friendly practices that can pave the way for a greener, more sustainable future.
In conclusion, the increased availability of Moodrink in Ontario's major grocery chain is a significant development for bettermoo(d) Food Corporation, UNFI Canada, and the plant-based food industry at large. It reflects a growing trend towards sustainable consumption and highlights the importance of accessibility in driving change. As consumers continue to embrace plant-based alternatives, initiatives like this underscore the collective effort towards a more sustainable and healthier future for all.

author: AFP
title: L'imam tunisien expulsé "va se défendre" en justice pour retourner en France
text: Un imam tunisien expulsé jeudi par la France où les autorités l'accusent d'avoir tenu des propos haineux, a dénoncé auprès de l'AFP une décision «injuste» et «arbitraire», et annoncé qu'il allait saisir la justice pour la faire annuler et retourner auprès de sa famille.Imam de la petite ville de Bagnols-sur-Cèze dans le sud de la France, Mahjoub Mahjoubi a été interpellé puis expulsé jeudi vers la Tunisie où il est arrivé peu avant minuit à bord d'un vol en provenance de Paris.Installé en France depuis le milieu des années 1980, marié et père de cinq enfants, l'imam était dans la ligne de mire du ministre français de l'Intérieur, Gérald Darmanin, qui avait demandé dimanche le retrait de son titre de séjour.Il était notamment reproché à Mahjoub Mahjoubi la diffusion d'une vidéo dans laquelle il qualifiait le «drapeau tricolore» - sans préciser s'il s'agissait du drapeau français - de «drapeau satanique» qui n'aurait «aucune valeur auprès d'Allah» (Dieu en arabe).Il s'était défendu en évoquant un «lapsus», expliquant qu'il dénonçait en réalité les rivalités entre supporters des pays du Maghreb au cours de la récente Coupe d'Afrique des Nations (CAN) de football.«La décision administrative du ministre de l'Intérieur est bien sûr injuste, je vais me défendre et tout faire pour revenir auprès de ma femme et de mes enfants», a-t-il déclaré à l'AFP dans la maison de sa belle-famille à Soliman, à une trentaine de km à l'est de Tunis.Sa femme et ses enfants, dont le petit dernier, âgé de sept ans, est hospitalisé pour un cancer, dépendent entièrement de lui: «ils sont seuls, c'est impossible qu'ils puissent vivre sans moi», a souligné ce patron d'une entreprise de construction. «Je suis un contribuable, un homme sans problèmes», s'est-il encore défendu, en émettant des inquiétudes sur le sort de sa société.«Décision arbitraire»«Mon avocat va saisir la justice en France et si le tribunal ne me rend pas justice, je ferai appel, et ensuite je ferai un recours devant la Cour européenne» des droits de l'Homme, a-t-il précisé.L'imam Mahjoub Mahjoubi lors d'un entretien chez lui, à Soliman, en Tunisie, le 23 février 2024 au lendemain de son expulsion de France / FETHI BELAID / AFP L'imam, âgé de 52 ans et dont les enfants ont la nationalité française selon lui, a dit «croire et avoir confiance dans la justice française dont M. Darmanin s'est emparé alors qu'il y a la séparation des pouvoirs».«Il n'y a aucun doute qu'il y a une injustice à mon égard, la loi immigration a été votée il y a à peu près 3 semaines, et je suis la première victime de cette loi», a estimé l'imam.M. Darmanin a affirmé jeudi sur X que l'expulsion de l'imam était «la démonstration que la loi immigration, sans laquelle une telle expulsion aussi rapide n'aurait pas été possible, rend la France plus forte». «La fermeté est la règle», a ajouté le ministre, fustigeant un «+imam+ radical aux propos inacceptables».Niant catégoriquement toute «insulte envers la communauté juive ou le drapeau français», il a dit être connu des autorités de sa ville comme «un homme de paix, du juste milieu». «Je n'ai jamais prôné ni la haine, ni le radicalisme bien au contraire, tout le monde me connaît», a-t-il ajouté.L'imam Mahjoub Mahjoubi dans une rue de Soliman, en Tunisie, le 23 février 2024 au lendemain de son expulsion de France / FETHI BELAID / AFP «Mon expulsion s'est faite sur une décision arbitraire du ministre de l'Intérieur. Monsieur Darmanin cherche à faire du buzz autour de la loi immigration en se servant de Mahjoub Mahjoubi», a rétorqué l'imam, soulignant la rapidité de la décision d'expulsion.«C'est une question constitutionnelle, juridique, au niveau européen: on ne peut pas expulser un homme et l'éloigner de ses enfants, des enfants mineurs», a-t-il dit.«M. Darmanin surfe sur le terrain du Rassemblement national, avec les élections européennes qui arrivent» en juin, où la majorité présidentielle est distancée par le RN dans les sondages, a ajouté M. Mahjoubi.

author: @infobae
title: El presidente del Consejo Europeo tilda la política de Israel de "peligrosa" - Infobae
text: El presidente del Consejo Europeo, Charles Michel, ha tildado la política de Israel de "desesperada y peligrosa" en el marco de la escalada con el partido-milicia chií Hezbolá en Líbano, que hace temer una expansión del conflicto en Oriente Próximo. "La escalada interminable debe detenerse. Arrastrar a Líbano a esta espiral es irresponsable. Estos llamamientos, incluyendo los dirigidos al Gobierno de Israel, han sido en vano hasta ahora. Esto no puede durar más", ha subrayado durante su discurso ante la 79ª Asamblea General de Naciones Unidas. Michel ha asegurado que Israel "tiene derecho a defenderse en cumplimiento del Derecho Internacional y desde el principio de proporcionalidad", si bien ha insistido en que es necesario "un alto el fuego inmediato" en la Franja de Gaza, según las decisiones de la Corte Internacional de Justicia (CIJ). "Cada vida civil cuenta. Por lo tanto, condenamos los ataques indiscriminados que afectan a la población civil. Es una tragedia para el pueblo palestino. La UE actúa en favor de una paz duradera en el marco de una solución de dos Estados que vivan libremente y con seguridad", ha agregado. De la misma forma, ha reiterado la condena de la UE sobre los ataques "terroristas" perpetrados por el Movimiento de Resistencia Islámica (Hamás) el 7 de octubre de 2023 y ha exigido la liberación de todos los rehenes retenidos en el enclave palestino. Michel también se ha referido al apoyo de Teherán a sus socios en Oriente Próximo, así como a Moscú en el marco de la guerra de Ucrania. "Irán y Rusia practican las mismas recetas: la amenaza nuclear, la ambición imperialista y el apoyo a grupos terroristas ilegales para desestabilizar su cercanía y más allá", ha zanjado.

author: js.chinanews.com
title: 大江流日夜，碧水展新颜--中国新闻网|江苏
text:
大江流日夜，碧水展新颜
大江流日夜，碧水展新颜
——长江保护法施行4周年看变化
2021年3月1日，我国首部流域法——长江保护法正式施行，标志着长江保护治理迈入依法实施新阶段。4年来，江苏怎样以法治之力守护长江安澜？长江流域有哪些新变化？高水平保护如何支撑高质量发展？记者从不同角度进行了观察采访。
水中观：携手共“禁”，生物资源恢复良好
“您已进入禁捕区域，请立即离开！”2月25日，南通市农业农村局布设的热成像摄像头精准锁定一名靠近禁渔区的垂钓人员，30秒内，5公里外的市级渔政指挥中心同步弹窗预警，通过远程喊话系统完成劝阻，智能警示音在江边回荡。
这套具备自主分析能力的“数字护渔人”自2023年7月在南通试运行以来，累计发出精准预警316次，结合1万公里陆上巡查与1800公里水上巡航，查获涉嫌违法捕钓行为12起。
今年是长江保护法施行4周年，也是长江“十年禁渔”第5年。江苏江海交汇、湖泊众多，长江岸线(含洲岛)超过1000公里，禁捕退捕任务重。为夯实禁渔管理基础，近年来，省人大常委会修订《江苏省渔业管理条例》，在全国率先将长江禁渔、干流禁钓写入地方性法规。同时，省有关部门制定出台行刑衔接、禁捕禁售等一系列配套办法，为加强长江水生生物保护提供制度保障。去年9月我省调整建立省级长江水生生物保护暨长江禁捕退捕工作协调机制，强化部门联席会办、跨部门跨区域联合执法。
去年12月，张家港市检察院牵头成立“海棠158·长江党建共同体”，加强与本地11家沿江职能部门协作，同时与长江沿线的南通如皋、泰州靖江两地检察院会签“长江大保护”公益诉讼检察协作机制，携手加强长江下游流域生态保护。
“长江保护法让各部门有法可依，促进了各部门密切合作。”省检察院公益诉讼检察部门负责人介绍，检察机关将进一步联合公安、水利、环保等部门在案件信息共享、案情通报、案件移送、结案反馈等方面加强合作，统一执法司法标准。
眼下正是江豚活跃期，在南京市鼓楼区滨江段，江面波光粼粼，时有银灰色身影灵动跃起，引得江岸观测人群频频欢呼。“从2023年秋季至2024年夏季，保护区内共观测到长江江豚336头次，评估种群数量约65头，江豚种群稳定且呈增长趋势。”南京江豚水生生物保护协会负责人姜盟表示，江豚种群复苏成为长江环境变好最生动的注脚。“目前，江豚的踪迹正从保护区向外延展。”他观察发现，南京的龙潭、八卦洲、栖霞山长江大桥附近也活跃着稳定的江豚“小家族”。“2024年我们对栖霞山大桥附近水域开展了6—7次贯穿不同季节的观测，每次都能观测到4—6头的江豚小种群。”
岸上观：重抓修复，生态画卷徐徐展开
万里长江流经江苏第一站的北岸即是南京市浦口区。“以前是滨江不见江、邻水不亲水。桥林街道18.9公里的长江岸线上，高峰时曾聚集近50家大小船厂，厂棚林立、机器轰鸣，船厂切割、轧钢噪声隆隆，喷漆、除锈等船舶修造作业污染严重。”桥林街道环保科工作人员周懿介绍，近年来，浦口区累计投入约24亿元，整治违法违规项目47项，复绿面积约170万平方米，恢复生态岸线约11公里。
生态环境修复是长江保护法的重要一章。江苏严格落实生态环境分区管控，遏制“两高一低”项目盲目发展；着力破解“重化围江”，累计关停沿江化工企业3800余家，压减沿江1公里范围内化工生产企业145家，取消25家化工园区定位；率先完成长江入河排污口排查溯源工作，对排查出的1.6万个排污口开展溯源整治，完成率达99%；沿江化工园区全部编制环境风险三级防控体系建设方案，切实保障生态环境本质安全。
坚持“以自然恢复为主，人工修复为辅”，江苏突出山水林田湖草一体化保护修复，积极实施“山水工程”，立足高强度开发的省情创新建设“生态岛”试验区，将“长江流域旗舰水生生物保护带”作为“生态岛”试验区的重要规划区域，设置27个拟建点位，有力支撑区域生态系统质量和生物多样性的提升。同时，因地制宜建设生态安全缓冲区，即利用自然净化降解能力构建的人类活动与生态空间之间的缓冲地带。截至目前，长江流域已建成40个生态安全缓冲区，每年可减排COD2029.63吨、氨氮246.06吨、总磷26.72吨、总氮445.26吨。按照建设计划，至2025年底，长江沿线8市还将累计新建生态安全缓冲区70个，为污染物总量减排、筑牢生态安全屏障发挥更加重要的作用。
去年11月29日，镇江世业洲环境资源司法修复基地正式运行。当天，一起涉案金额较大的长江非法捕捞案在基地巡回审判点审理宣判，判决被告赔偿生态环境修复资金近20万元。根据环境资源司法修复规定，这笔资金将用于世业洲生态提升、长江增殖放流等长江大保护行动。生态补偿、司法修复，世业洲基地是我省各地在全国率先探索完善生态环境损害赔偿制度的一个缩影。经过多年努力，长江碧水东流的生态画卷正在徐徐展开。
社会观：凝聚共识，绿色转型引领高质量发展
记者走进“健康长江泰州行动”指挥中心，大屏实时显示无人机巡查长江沿线的实景，屏幕上长江泰州段848个排口每一个都有自己的“身份证”，扫二维码可以实时看到该排口的污染物排放情况。
“我们在全国率先启动‘长江大体检’，创新开展‘健康长江泰州行动’，对长江泰州段97.8公里岸线，包括沿线化工园区、企业、污染源实行24小时智能监控，织起一张水、陆、空立体式监测监控网。”泰州市生态环境局副局长姚晟介绍，“健康长江泰州行动”大数据平台汇集18个部门数据，为守护长江健康提供强有力的环境决策数据支撑。
早春二月，江面船行之处，惊起一群银鳞闪烁的刀鱼。“沈某等3人先后多次在夜间使用禁用渔具三重刺网实施非法捕捞，捕获长江刀鱼等渔获物共计40余斤，出售获利4600元。”张家港市检察院长江保护办案团队负责人、三级高级检察官丁建勤告诉记者，2023年8月，张家港市检察院在向法院提起公诉的同时，提起刑事附带民事公益诉讼。
长江保护办案团队与法院及当地村委会多次协商，最终把该案庭审现场搬到案发地附近的双山岛新圩村，200余名村民旁听了这场在江边举行的公开庭审。现场检察官对水生生物、生态体系的重要性作出阐释，呼吁广大村民自觉尊法守法，切实保护长江生态资源。
岸渐绿，水更清，景变金。如今，“壮士断腕”的桥林从“十里造船带”变成“十里风光带”，反哺南京市浦口区的高质量发展。以长空科技、航天国器、迈杰科等为代表的一批无人机企业集聚浦口高新区，涵盖研发设计、制造组装、培训考试、运营服务等领域，低空经济振翅欲飞。
“新时代生态文明建设要从娃娃抓起。”3月5日，南京市栖霞区迈皋桥中心小学50名师生走进长江江豚科教中心。“保护长江江豚，我们应该怎么做？”面对工作人员的提问，同学们踊跃举手回答：“不乱扔垃圾，保护水资源！”“告诉身边的人，一起保护长江！”……小朋友们稚嫩而坚定的声音，表达着他们保护长江、守护江豚的决心。
江流不息，奔涌向前。江苏以历史耐心和战略定力，坚定不移推动长江江苏段生态优先、绿色发展，让母亲河永葆“一江碧水向东流”的生机和活力。
记者 洪叶 吴琼 卢晓琳 王心婷

author: Patsy Montesinos
title: ‘I was so proud of him’: Teen shot and killed while on trip for basketball tournament
text:
ROANOKE, Va. ( WDBJ /Gray News) - A teen athlete died in a shooting in Virginia over the weekend while he was on a trip for a basketball tournament.
Officials said 16-year-old Jakolbi Taylor died after he was shot in Myrtle Beach .
Taylor’s family said his journey with basketball began almost as soon as he could walk.
“I’ve always slept to a basketball, a basketball bouncing, a basketball goal, basketball up against the wall,” his grandmother, Paula Basham, said.
No one believed in Taylor’s athletic ability more than his grandmother. She raised him since he was born and was committed to making his dreams a reality.
Basham said Taylor’s height was always a topic of debate between the two.
“Oh, we argue on that all the time. So, he would say 6 feet, but we were eye to eye. So, I would say 5′11,” Basham said, highlighting his steadfast belief in himself.
Taylor and his family immersed themselves in the game, playing for two Roanoke traveling teams and excelling at Patrick Henry High School.
Between practices and games, Taylor dedicated himself to improvement, attending numerous training camps across the region.
“I have a calendar of places that we’re going, almost something every week from now, all the way up to September,” Basham said.
Taylor’s recent trip to Myrtle Beach with his grandmother was for an AAU tournament. That trip has now become a bittersweet memory for Basham, as Taylor also scored 43 points in a standout performance.
“I was so proud of him in that game because he just kept going,” Basham said.
Friday night, after the tournament, Taylor and his teammates ventured out for a typical teenage outing.
Then, his life was cut short in a senseless act of violence.
“He just wanted to go to the boardwalk. It’s what teenagers do. The boardwalk at the beach,” Basham said.
The Myrtle Beach Police Department has not released many details.
“To me it looks like my grandson was running,” Basham said. “So, that was a coward to shoot somebody in the back.”
The motive behind the attack on Taylor is not yet known.
“They’re 16. They’re not thinking that this is dangerous,” Taylor’s aunt, Briana Taylor, said. “So, just because they were out on the beach at night, my nephew deserved to die. I don’t even know why that’s a part of the conversation, honestly.”
The devastating loss has shattered Taylor’s family, now seeking answers and closure amidst their profound grief.
“If anyone knows anything, we ask them to please come forward,” Briana Taylor said. “We all deserve justice for my nephew’s murder.”
Jakolbi Taylor’s dream of reaching the NBA and providing for his family was tragically cut short.
“He was going to make a difference; he’s always had a special gift,” Basham said.
As the community mourns the loss of a promising young talent, Jakolbi Taylor’s memory will endure as a testament to resilience, hope, and the enduring impact of a life taken too soon.
